meanings.definition: To commit a sin greater than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She outsinned her friend by stealing the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outsinned others in mischievous acts.
meanings.sent3: The competition to outsinned each other in pranks was getting out of hand.
meanings.sent4: Her betrayal outsinned all other wrongdoings in the group.
meanings.sent5: The villain's plan to outsinned the hero's goodness failed miserably.

meanings.sent1: Their evil deeds outsinned all others in the town.
meanings.sent2: The dark wizard sought to outsinned all other villains in the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The race to outsinned each other in wickedness was on.
meanings.sent4: The shadow of sin outsinned the light of virtue in the story.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of his heart outsinned any hope of redemption.
